item.title: Rakuten buys struggling bitcoin startup Bitnet to create a 'blockchain research lab'
item.description:
Rakuten buys struggling bitcoin startup Bitnet to create a 'blockchain research lab'

Rakuten has confirmed that it has acquired the assets of Bitnet, a bitcoin wallet startup it invested in, which will be used to create a 'bitcoin lab' for the Japanese retail giant. The transaction is undisclosed but it follows a Wall Street Journal report in July which speculated that a deal was in the works.

item.title: Expect ransomware arrests soon, says bitcoin tracking firm Chainalysis
item.description:
Expect ransomware arrests soon, says bitcoin tracking firm Chainalysis

Ransomware has become one of the biggest cyber threats to business, healthcare and government organisations in the past six months, but bitcoin tracking firm Chainalysis expects the tide to turn. Cyber criminal gangs that extort money by encrypting data using malware or threatening distributed denial of service (DDoS) attacks, typically demand payment in bitcoin so it cannot be traced.

item.title: Bitcoin is still an inaccessible, obscure experiment-but Bitcoin 2.0 could change our lives
item.description:
Bitcoin is still an inaccessible, obscure experiment-but Bitcoin 2.0 could change our lives

Five years ago, bitcoin was an obscure and esoteric online currency, used by few and understood by fewer. Today, after half a decade of sturm, drang, and drama-not to mention multi-million dollar hacks and grandiose proclamations-it is ... an obscure and esoteric online currency, used by few and understood by fewer.

item.title: The Blush Family's Bitcoin Bus Tour: Dash Across America
item.description:
The Blush Family's Bitcoin Bus Tour: Dash Across America

A family of four have decided to test the limits of cryptocurrencies by dashing across America in their Bitcoin Bus, spending only cryptocurrency along the way. John Bush, Catherine Bleish, their two children, and their two dogs have endeavored to take on the challenge of traveling across the U.S.

item.title: Warning! Next Bitcoin Core Version Could be Hacked, Reads Advisory
item.description:
Warning! Next Bitcoin Core Version Could be Hacked, Reads Advisory

The next version of Bitcoin Core, a popular digital wallet for the cryptocurrency, could be hacked and replaced with a malicious look-alike by state sponsored actors, reads a safety warning. On 17 August, open-source project Bitcoin.org announced the threat on its website.

item.title: California Lawmaker: Bitcoin Thefts Show Industry Regulation Needed - CoinDesk
item.description:
California Lawmaker: Bitcoin Thefts Show Industry Regulation Needed - CoinDesk

The state assemblyman behind efforts to regulate digital currency businesses in California cited the $65m hack of Bitfinex this week as evidence of the need for tighter industry controls. In a statement issued following his state's decision to temporarily shelve new rulemakings this year, he said that more time was needed to strike a balance between giving virtual currency businesses a firm foundation and ensuring consumers are protected.

item.title: Bitcoin Ponzi Schemer Hints at Dealings With Mt Gox CEO - CoinDesk
item.description:
Bitcoin Ponzi Schemer Hints at Dealings With Mt Gox CEO - CoinDesk

Convicted Ponzi scheme operator Trendon Shavers is now insinuating the major unidentified debtor cited in his defense against the SEC was Mark Karpeles, CEO of the now-defunct bitcoin exchange Mt Gox.

item.title: Why Ethereum Classic Must Die - CoinDesk
item.description:
Why Ethereum Classic Must Die - CoinDesk

Jacob Eliosoff is a computer programmer and former Wall Street quant who runs Calibrated Markets LLC, a cryptocurrency investment firm with holdings in BTC and ETH. In this opinion piece, Eliosoff discusses why he believes the ethereum community needs to unite around one implementation of the protocol, and why he believes it should be the version that opted for a controversial fork.

item.title: Security questions dog Bitcoin over hacks
item.description:
Security questions dog Bitcoin over hacks

By , @bayareanewsgroup.com Posted: 08/19/2016 06:11:58 PM PDT Updated: 08/19/2016 06:11:58 PM PDT It seemed bitcoin exchange Bitfinex was doing all the right things. In the end, that didn't stop hackers from stealing $65 million. The latest in a long list of attacks on the digital currency since its birth in 2009 has been particularly vexing for the bitcoin community.

item.title: In the Bitcoin Era, Ransomware Attacks Surge
item.description:
In the Bitcoin Era, Ransomware Attacks Surge

One evening in April, Dave Winston stood in a convenience store in suburban Charlotte, N.C., uneasily shoving $20 bills into a slim automated-teller machine unlike any he had ever seen. He was buying bitcoin, a digital currency unknown to him a few hours earlier, before hackers took over his computer.
